chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Attorney's Fees .. to Taylor Hart

1:34 PM  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David J. Diaz in court.  Attorney Taylor M Hart in court for David J. Diaz.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Hart states DE will waive his right to prelim today and proceed through to plea/sent today.  State notes they are in compliance w/victim's rights.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Hart states the plea agreement.  DE and State agree.  Court questions DE on the plea agreement.  DE pleads NC to counts 1 and 2.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court reviews VIS from Kalahari.  Atty Hart also rec/rev that VIS w/the DE.  State makes statement on behalf of the joint recommendation.  Atty Hart makes statement on behalf of the DE.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE to report to P&P by 3:30 today.

Ct 1:  NC - DC
30 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentences IMPOSED & STAYED

Ct 2:  NC - CDTP
60 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentences IMPOSED & STAYED

Ct 3:  Dismissed/read-in

Probation on Cts 1 and 2 for 24 months
Costs/surcharges of $543.00 in Ct 1 and $453.00 in Ct 2 to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
Restitution (plus surcharges of $1,150.00 to Kalahari) - to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office as a condition of probation
AODA and follow up treatment/counseling per agent
Three (3) days credit if revoked
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David J. Diaz not in court.  Attorney Taylor M Hart in court for David J. Diaz.  Transportation issues.  Misdemeanor resolution.  Plea/Setencing Frinday.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stayed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE not eligible for PD representation.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests signature bond.  Atty. Markoski request Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $2500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No violent or abusive contact w/C.N.L. No contact or be upon premises of Kalahari Resort  Return date scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
